**Dragonbane** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [unaligned](/wiki/Unaligned "Unaligned"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.4 UnNetHack and SporkHack](#UnNetHack_and_SporkHack)
  - [5.5 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

A randomly generated broadsword has a base 1⁄20 chance of being made into Dragonbane if no artifacts have already been generated. Any character may receive Dragonbane as a sacrifice gift, though it will never be the first one given.

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") that generate with a broadsword have a 1⁄2 chance of that broadsword being turned into Dragonbane if it has not yet generated.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

Dragonbane has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") against [dragons](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") - while wielded, it grants [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").

## Strategy

Though most [Banes](/wiki/Banes "Banes") are not considered useful due to their narrow ranges for damage bonuses, Dragonbane is much more viable for general use than the others by strength of its reflection, and dragons are fairly valuable and dangerous targets - Dragonbane is also more [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")-friendly than a [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), though most builds will prefer the [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") or [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail"). In some cases, [two-weaponing](/wiki/Two-weaponing "Two-weaponing") Dragonbane with a good offhand weapon offers better damage than a single weapon and shield.

Dragonbane is especially useful for procuring [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scale "Dragon scale") from [reverse genocided](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide") dragons to convert into [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), particularly for [wishless](/wiki/Wishless "Wishless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"). Though not at all necessary, [Cavemen](/wiki/Cavemen "Cavemen") that receive Dragonbane as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") can use it to deal with the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon").

## History

Dragonbane first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

Dragonbane's ability to grant reflection while wielded is added in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"), and is imported from [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack").

## Variants

Variants based on [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions may or may not include reflection as in later versions.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Dragonbane's to-hit bonus is a flat +5, and like all Banes it has a 3⁄20 chance of [canceling](/wiki/Canceling "Canceling") any dragon it hits.

### dNetHack

Dragonbane has been replaced with [Dragonlance](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Dragonlance "DNetHack artifacts").

### EvilHack

- *Main article: [Dragonbane (EvilHack)](/wiki/Dragonbane_\(EvilHack\) "Dragonbane (EvilHack)")*

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Dragonbane is changed to a [pair of dragonhide gloves](/wiki/Pair_of_gloves "Pair of gloves").

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") and [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") Dragonbane is instead a [dwarvish spear](/wiki/Dwarvish_spear "Dwarvish spear") that confers fire, cold, acid, sleep, disintegration and shock resistance while wielded, and has a 50% chance of instantly slaying dragons (reduced to 20% in UnNetHack[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)). It also gets +d5 to hit and +d4 damage against all enemies. (If you are polymorphed into a dragon, a monster wielding Dragonbane can instantly kill you!)

In UnNetHack, Dragonbane also grants [warning of dragons](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type").

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), Dragonbane is an artifact lance that confers reflection[\[3\]](#cite_note-3). Because it is an artifact, it will never break when jousting. The damage bonus is changed from double damage to +1d20. Dragonbane has half the weight of a regular lance. It's the first sacrifice gift for [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight").

If you are granted Dragonbane, you will also receive a free saddle and the riding skill will be unrestricted.
